SVG

  1. Scalable Vector Graphics (SVG)

    SVG is a web technique that enable developers to draw anyhing they want on a broswer.

    SVG is an XML language, provide DOM in broswer environment, which means it can be modified by JS.

    Example of usage of SVG:
    1. tinkercard, which uses SVG to draw circuit, arduino.
    2. maps

    A SVG graph is a set of basic SVG elements, such as line, circle, text, rect, ellipse and path.

    Each SVG basic element has its attributes and styles. Some styles are common, such as fill, stroke, stroke-width...

    SVG working space

    A SVG graph is enclosed by svg tag. The svg tag defines a SVG 2D working space with width and heigth.
    The coordinate: (0,0) is the left top corner, x-asix to the right, y-asix to the bottom.

    viewBox

    <svg width="200" height="100" viewBox="0 0 400 200"></svg>

    width and height declare a space in the broswer in terms of (screen) pixel.
    viewBox defines the user's unit. By default, the user's unit is same as the screen unit.
    It means width=200, height=100, you have 200 * 100 pixel space to draw anything you want.

    However, with viewBox, you can re-design the user unit. The above example declare a 200 * 100 space. But it allows you to draw 400 * 200 graph. To achieve this, the image become smaller. 1/4 of original size.

    viewBox: x, y, w, h.

    w h are the new space
    The width and height are equally scaled.
    <svg width="200" height="100" viewBox="0 0 200 200"></svg> It scale the height by 2 and width also by 2. And shift the width to the middle.
    x y are the shift value
    The x and y are shift value in the user unit. <svg width="200" height="100" viewBox="100 0 200 200"></svg>

  2. SVG Element

    The default SVG unit is pixel, we don't need to explict write the px.

    1. rect

      <rect x="30" y="50" height="30" width="50"></rect>

    2. circle: stroke-width affect the real size of the circle.

      <circle cx="30" cy="50" r="30"></circle>

      Others: ellipse

    3. text

      <text x="0" y="55" text-anchor="middle" >Message</text>

      text-anchor: start -> the text left bottom is at (x, y)
      middle -> the text middle bottom is at (x,y)
      end-> the text right bottom is at (x, y)
      Text anchor can also be a style attribute.

    4. polygon and path

      SVG Path is a big topic, please go to here.

  3. SVG element's style

    The common style attributes for svf elements include fill, stroke, stroke-width

    Special styles

    1. line: stroke-lincap: round. The two end points of a line

  4. SVG Group and transform

    Use group g, it is easy to manage SVG element. E.g. group transform.

    <g transform="translate(20, 20) rotate(40) translate(10)‚Äù> </g>

    1. create a new coordinate, shift it to 20 pixels in the x-direction and 20 pixels in the y-direction
    2. create a new coordinate, rotate the group 40 degrees clockwise based on its parent.
    3. create a new coordinate, shift 10 pixel in the x-direction (10 pixels along the 40 degree line)
